tuv.seg: Consent to medical and surgical procedures
Toiliú don chóireáil leighis agus máinliach
As a general rule, medical or surgical procedures may not be carried out without the informed consent of the patient
Mar riail ginearálta, ní féidir cóireáil leighis ná máinliach a chur ar dhuine gan toiliú eolasach a fháil ón othar féin
The Assisted Decision-Making (Capacity) Act 2015 provides laws to support decision-making by adults who have difficulty in making decisions without help
Níl an dlí soiléir céard ba cheart tarlú sa chás nach féidir leis an othar toiliú, mar shampla, má tá easláinte intinne i gceist nó má tá sé/sí gan aithne gan urlabhra
The Act was signed into law on 30 December 2015 but has not yet been commenced to bring it into effect. Read more about the Act (pdf)
Chomh maith leis sin, níl sé iomlán soiléir cén toiliú go díreach atá ag teastáil i gcás leanaí
Until the Act is commenced, the law is not clear on what should happen in cases where the patient is unable to give consent because, for example, of a mental disorder or because he/she is comatose
Tá mionrialacha ann maidir le hiompar tástálacha cliniciúla agus an t-eolas nach mór a thabhairt do rannpháirtithe na dtástálacha seo
In general, valid consent must be informed consent where the patient has sufficient information to be able to understand the nature of what is proposed and the potential risks and benefits involved
Go ginearálta, is ionann toiliú bailí agus toiliú eolasach. Níl an dlí soiléir ar cé mhéid eolais nach mór do dhochtúir a thabhairt d'othar
The patient must have the capacity to make the decision and must be free to do so without threat or pressure from others
Tá an toiliú leagtha síos sa dlí anois maidir le cóireáil síciatrach ach níl i gcás aon chóireála eile
If there is no consent
Nuair nach bhfuil aon toiliú ann
If a person carries out medical or surgical procedures without consent, he/she could be charged with the crime of assault - the decision on charges is made by the Director of Public Prosecutions

Má chuireann duine cóireáil leighs ná máinliach ar dhuine gan toiliú a fháil, d'fhéadfaí é/í a chúisiú as coir an ionsaithe - is é/í Stiúrthóir na nIonchúiseamh Poiblí a dhéanann an cinneadh duine a chúisiú
He/she could also be sued for the tort (civil wrong) of trespass to the person and possibly for breach of constitutional rights
D'fhéadfaí an dlí a chur air/uirthi as tort (éagóir shibhialta) na foghla ar dhuine agus b'fhéidir as cearta bunreachtúla an duine a shárú
If the person involved is a medical professional, he/she could also be sued for negligence
Más duine gairmiúil den lucht leighis atá i gceist, d'fhéadfaí an dlí a chur air/uirthi as faillí a bheith déanta
The patient may take these actions
Is féidir leis an othar na himeachtaí seo a thógáil
If you are a mentally competent adult, there is no doubt about the need for consent but what exactly constitutes informed consent is not totally clear
Más duine fásta inniúil de mheabhair thú níl aon dabht ach go dteastaíonn toiliú uait ach níl sé soiléir céard go díreach é an toiliú eolasach
You may give a general consent – for example, you may tell your doctor to do what he/she considers best
B'fhéidir go mbeadh toiliú ginearálta tugtha agat - mar shampla, b'fhéidir go mbeadh sé ráite agat le do dhochtúir déanamh mar a chreideann sé/sí féin a bheith ceart
You may give implied consent by not specifically ruling out certain procedures
D'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh toiliú intuigthe tugtha agat ós rud é nár luaigh tú cóireáil faoi leith nár theastaigh uait toiliú lena aghaidh
Your implied consent may arise out of necessity – for example, if unexpected complications arise during an operation
B'fhéidir go dtiocfadh do thoiliú intuighte i gceist de bharr riachtanais - mar shampla, má thagann deacrachtaí aníos nach raibh aon súil leo i rith obráide
If you are seriously ill and not in a position to give or withhold consent, the doctor may carry out what would be considered usual procedures arising from necessity
Má tá tú go dona tinn agus muna bhfuil tú in ann toiliú a thabhairt nó a dhiúltú, d'fhéadfadh an dochtúir an chóireáil a bheadh tugtha de ghnáth a chur ort de bharr riachtanais
Sometimes doctors may consult with your family or nearest relatives but they really have no legal right to give or withhold consent
B'fhéidir go rachadh na dochtúirí i gcomhairle le do theaghlach nó le do neasghaol ach i ndáiríre níl aon cheart dlíthiúil acu toiliú don chóireáil nó diúltú dí
Refusal of medical treatment
Diúltú don chóireáil leighis
It is clear that, if you are a mentally competent adult, you have the right to refuse or discontinue medical treatment even if the inevitable consequence is that you will die
Má tá sé soiléir gur duine fásta inniúil de mheabhair thú, tá sé de cheart agat diúltú don chóireáil leighis nó deireadh a chur leis fiú más rud é go mbeadh an bás mar thoradh ar an gcinneadh sin
This is different from taking positive measures to end your own life or another person's life
Ní ionann seo agus céimeanna dearfacha a thógáil lámh a chur i do bhás féin nó i mbás duine eile
If you are not mentally competent, you are not in a position to make a decision about refusing or discontinuing medical treatment
Muna bhfuil tú inniúil de mheabhair, ní féidir leat cinneadh a dhéanamh diúltú don chóireáil nó deireadh a chur léi
The law is not clear on exactly who is competent to do this
Níl an dlí iomlán soiléir ar cé go díreach atá inniúil é seo a dhéanamh
In general, a medical professional may make decisions that the treatment should be discontinued for medical reasons
Go ginearálta, is féidir le duine gairmiúil leighis cinneadh a dhéanamh gur ceart deireadh a chur leis an gcóireáil ar chúiseanna leighis
In some countries, Advance Healthcare Directives may be considered legally valid but there has been no ruling on this in Ireland
I dtíortha éagsúla, glactar go bhfuil "uachtanna beo" dlíthiúil agus bailí ach níl aon rialú déanta in Éirinn ar seo
An Advance Healthcare Directive is a document in which a person sets out their wishes about the continuation or otherwise of medical treatment if they should become mentally incapable

Is cáipéis í "Uacht bheo" ina leagann duine síos céard a bheadh ag teastáil uaidh/uaithi maidir le cóireáil leighis a fháil agus leanacht leis sa chás nach raibh sé/sí inniúil de mheabhair an cinneadh a dhéanamh
The Assisted Decision-Making (Capacity) Act 2015 provides laws to support decision-making by adults who have difficulty in making decisions without help
Má tá cumhacht bhuan aturnae ag duine ní bhíonn sé de chumhacht aige/aici cinneadh den chineál seo a dhéanamh ar son an té a bhronn an chumhacht air/uirthi
The Act also provides laws for Advance Healthcare Directives
Ní coir é an féinmharú féin ná iarracht a dhéanamh tú féin a mharú
The Act was signed into law on 30 December 2015 but has not yet been commenced to bring it into effect
Ach, is coir choiriúil í cúnamh a thabhairt do dhuine eile céimeanna a thógáil le deireadh a chur lena s(h)aol féin
An enduring power of attorney does not give the attorney the power to make decisions of this nature on behalf of the person granting the power
D'fhéadfaí an chúis seo a bheith i gceist is cuma más duine proifisiúnta den lucht leighis é/í an cúntóir nó nach ea
It is the practice for doctors and other medical professionals to get the consent of parents or guardians for medical and surgical procedures to be carried out on minors

Lorgaíonn dochtúirí agus lucht proifisiúnta leighis eile toiliú tuismitheoirí nó caomhnóirí má tá cóireáil leighis nó máinliach le cur ar dhaoine óga. Níl an dlí soiléir faoin ábhar seo ach is cosúil go bhfuil glactha leis go dteastaíonn toiliú tuismitheoirí
The Supreme Court has held that a health board (now replaced by the Health Service Executive) did not have the right to insist on having a test carried out on a child without parental permission
Bhí cás ós comhair na Cúirte Uachtaraí le deireanas a leag síos nach bhfuil sé de cheart ag bord sláinte an tástáil sáile a dhéanamh ar pháiste gan toiliú na dtuismitheoirí
This case involved the PKU or heel pin-prick test, which is usually carried out on babies shortly after birth
Bhain an cás seo leis an tástáil sáile nó feinilcéatónúire (PKU) a dhéantar go hiondúil ar leanaí go gairid tar éis a mbreithe
The Supreme Court held that only in exceptional circumstances would the court intervene and make an order contrary to the wishes of the parents
Is cosúil go mbeadh an Chúirt sásta leas an linbh a chur san áireamh agus b’fhéidir cearta an linbh a chur roimh cearta na dtuismitheoirí
Section 23 of the Non-Fatal Offences Against the Person Act, 1997 provides that young people of 16 and over may give valid consent to medical, surgical and dental treatment

Faoi Alt 23 d'Acht um Chionta Neamh-Mharfacha i Aghaidh an Duine 1997 is féidir le daoine óga de 16 bliain d'aois agus ós a chionn toiliú bailí a thabhairt do chóireáil leighis, máinliach agus fiaclóireachta
Consent to psychiatric treatment
Toiliú don chóireáil síciatrach
There are specific laws about consent in relation to the rights of psychiatric patients
Ar mhaithe leis seo, is ionann toiliú agus toiliú scríofa, faighte gan bhac, gan aon bhagairt ná mealladh:
The National Consent Policy applies to services provided by or on behalf of the Health Service Executive (HSE)
Leagann an tAcht síos na rialacha a bhaineann le toiliú na rannpháirtithe a fháil do thástálacha cliniciúla
The National Consent Policy and guides are available for download
• tú in ann nádúr, brí agus scóip an toilithe a thuiscint agus
These include guides for patients, professionals and young people
Tá sé de chead agat do thoiliú a tharraingt siar ag am ar bith
